DataElement.preferredName: Urine Collection At Patient Visit And Human Papillomavirus Testing Patient Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator for whether the participant agrees that their urine can be collected at Study Visits and they may be used for detecting HPV.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Urine Collection At Patient Visit And Human Papillomavirus Testing Patient Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Used to indicate position, location, or state._A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._A strain of papillomavirus that can infect the skin and mucous membranes of humans._A procedure for critical evaluation._The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Used to indicate position, location, or state.
A visit by a patient or study participant to a medical professional.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
A strain of papillomavirus that can infect the skin and mucous membranes of humans.
The fluid that is excreted by the kidneys.  It is stored in the bladder and discharged through the urethra.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did the participant agree to
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the participant agree to provide a small cup of urine at the indicated study visits and agree that their samples may be used to look for HPV infection in their body?
